intro: Chamaescilla spiralis, commonly known as the spiral rock heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and floral display.
